trans-unit.source: VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA data type

seg-source.mrk: VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA data type

target.mrk: VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA data type

trans-unit.source: The VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA type allows you to store binary strings less than or equal to a specified length. It is useful for unstructured data where character strings are not appropriate (e.g., images).

seg-source.mrk: The VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA type allows you to store binary strings less than or equal to a specified length.
It is useful for unstructured data where character strings are not appropriate (e.g., images).

target.mrk: The VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA type allows you to store binary strings less than or equal to a specified length.
It is useful for unstructured data where character strings are not appropriate (e.g., images).

trans-unit.source: { VARCHAR | CHAR VARYING | CHARACTER VARYING } (length) FOR BIT DATA

seg-source.mrk: { VARCHAR | CHAR VARYING | CHARACTER VARYING } (length) FOR BIT DATA

target.mrk: { VARCHAR | CHAR VARYING | CHARACTER VARYING } (length) FOR BIT DATA

trans-unit.source: <i>length</i > is an unsigned integer literal designating the length in bytes.

seg-source.mrk: <i>length</i > is an unsigned integer literal designating the length in bytes.

target.mrk: <i>length</i > is an unsigned integer literal designating the length in bytes.

trans-unit.source: Unlike the case for the CHAR FOR BIT DATA type, there is no default length for a VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA type. The maximum size of the length value is 32,672 bytes.

seg-source.mrk: Unlike the case for the CHAR FOR BIT DATA type, there is no default length for a VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA type.
The maximum size of the length value is 32,672 bytes.

target.mrk: Unlike the case for the CHAR FOR BIT DATA type, there is no default length for a VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA type.
The maximum size of the length value is 32,672 bytes.

trans-unit.source: VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA stores variable-length byte strings. Unlike CHAR FOR BIT DATA values, VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA values are not padded out to the target length.

seg-source.mrk: VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA stores variable-length byte strings.
Unlike CHAR FOR BIT DATA values, VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA values are not padded out to the target length.

target.mrk: VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA stores variable-length byte strings.
Unlike CHAR FOR BIT DATA values, VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA values are not padded out to the target length.

trans-unit.source: An operation on a VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA and a CHAR FOR BIT DATA value (e.g., a concatenation) yields a VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA value.

seg-source.mrk: An operation on a VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA and a CHAR FOR BIT DATA value (e.g., a concatenation) yields a VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA value.

target.mrk: An operation on a VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA and a CHAR FOR BIT DATA value (e.g., a concatenation) yields a VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA value.

trans-unit.source: The type of a byte literal is always a VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA, not a CHAR FOR BIT DATA.

seg-source.mrk: The type of a byte literal is always a VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA, not a CHAR FOR BIT DATA.

target.mrk: The type of a byte literal is always a VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA, not a CHAR FOR BIT DATA.
